verse_text: And the men of Ephraim said to him, â€œWhat is this, that you wanted to do, so that you would not call us when you went to fight against Midian?â€ And they rebuked him strongly, and came close to using violence
And he responded to them: â€œBut what could I have done that would be so great as what you have done? Is not one bunch of grapes of Ephraim better than the vintages of Abiezer

The Lord has delivered into your hands the leaders of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb. What could I have done that would be so great as what you have done?â€ And when he had said this, their spirit, which was swelling up against him, was quieted
And when Gideon had arrived at the Jordan, he crossed over it with the three hundred men who were with him. And they were so weary that they were unable to pursue those who were fleeing
And he said to the men of Succoth, â€œI beg you, give bread to the people who are with me, for they are greatly weakened, so that we may be able to pursue Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.
The leaders of Succoth answered, â€œPerhaps the palms of the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna are in your hand, and for this reason, you request that we give bread to your army.
And he said to them, â€œSo then, when the Lord will have delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I will thresh your flesh with the thorns and briers of the desert.
And going up from there, he arrived at Penuel. And he spoke to the men of that place similarly. And they also answered him, just as the men of Succoth had answered
And so he said to them also, â€œWhen I will have returned as a victor in peace, I will destroy this tower.

Now Zebah and Zalmunna were resting with their entire army. For fifteen thousand men were left out of all the troops of the eastern people. And one hundred twenty thousand warriors that drew the sword had been cut down

And Gideon ascended by the way of those who were dwelling in tents, to the eastern part of Nobah and Jogbehah. And he struck the camp of the enemies, who were confident and were suspecting nothing adverse
And Zebah and Zalmunna fled. And Gideon pursued and overtook them, sending their entire army into confusion
And returning from the war before sunrise
he took a boy from among the men of Succoth. And he asked him the names of the leaders and elders of Succoth. And he described seventy-seven men

And he went to Succoth, and he said to them: â€œBehold Zebah and Zalmunna, over whom you rebuked me, saying: â€˜Perhaps the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna are in your hands, and for this reason, you request that we give bread to men who are languishing and weakened.â€™
Therefore, he took the elders of the city, and, using the thorns and briers of the desert, he threshed them with these, and he cut the men of Succoth to pieces
He also overturned the tower of Penuel, and he killed the men of the city
And he said to Zebah and Zalmunna, â€œWhat kind of men were those whom you killed at Tabor?â€ They responded, â€œThey were like you, and one of them was like the son of a king.
He answered them: â€œThey were my brothers, the sons of my mother. As the Lord lives, if you had preserved them, I would not kill you.
And he said to Jether, his firstborn son, â€œRise up, and put them to death.â€ But he did not draw his sword. For he was afraid, being still a boy

And Zebah and Zalmunna said: â€œYou should rise up and rush against us. For the strength of a man is in accord with his age.â€ Gideon rose up, and he killed Zebah and Zalmunna. And he took the ornaments and studs, with which the necks of the royal camels are usually adorned
And all the men of Israel said to Gideon: â€œYou should rule over us, and your son, and your sonâ€™s son. For you freed us from the hand of Midian.
And he said to them: â€œI will not rule over you. Neither shall my son rule over you. Instead, the Lord shall rule over you.
And he said to them: â€œI petition one request from you. Give me the earrings from your spoils.â€ For the Ishmaelites were accustomed to wear gold earrings
They responded, â€œWe are very willing to give them.â€ And spreading a cloak on the ground, they cast upon it the earrings from the spoils

And the weight of the earrings that he requested was one thousand seven hundred shekels of gold, aside from the ornaments, and necklaces, and purple garments, which the kings of Midian were accustomed to use, and aside from the gold chains on the camels
And Gideon made an ephod from these, and he kept it in his city, Ophrah. And all of Israel committed fornication with it, and it became a ruin to Gideon and to all his house
But Midian was humbled before the sons of Israel. Neither were they able any longer to lift up their necks. But the land rested for forty years, while Gideon presided
And so Jerubbaal, the son of Joash, went and lived in his own house
And he had seventy sons, who went forth from his own thigh. For he had many wives
But his concubine, whom he had in Shechem, bore him a son named Abimelech
And Gideon, the son of Joash, died in a good old age, and he was buried in the sepulcher of his father, at Ophrah, of the family of Ezri
But after Gideon died, the sons of Israel turned away, and they committed fornication with the Baals. And they struck a covenant with Baal, so that he would be their god
And they did not remember the Lord their God, who rescued them from the hands of all their enemies on all sides
Neither did they show mercy to the house of Jerubbaal Gideon, in accord with all the good that he had done for Israel
